bibl.title: Letter from Cornelia Knox Kean to Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, November 12, 1952 [Enclosed in 06504126]

div1.p: Kean is unable to accept the invitation to attend the ceremonies honoring the heroes of the conquest of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Cornelia Knox Kean to Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, November 12, 1952 [Enclosed in 06504126]
div1.opener:
Copy
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON 7, D. C.
12 November 1952
My dear Sr. Exposito:
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of
November 7th and wish to thank you and
Dr. Recio for your invitation to attend
the ceremonies on December 3rd honoring
the herosES of the Conquest of Yellow Fever.

With my thanks to you and to
Dr. Alberto Recio for your memory of
General Kean, and my regrets that I
will be unable to accept your
courteous invitation
div1.closer: Yours Sincerely Cornelia Kean (Mrs. J.R. Kean)
